title: Château Maucoil 2014 Privilège Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Earthen notes of freshly tilled soil and garrigue lend depth to plump strawberry and blackberry in this bold yet nuanced wine. It's sunny and pliant on the palate, but fine, feathery tannins linger persistently, along with piquant hints of anise and leather. It drinks well already but should hold nicely through 2027.

title: Buchegger 2016 Ried Moosburgerin Reserve Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: A pure streak of freshly cut green pear on the nose promises a bight, lively wine. The palate is indeed bright and slender, dominated by that pure, lithe, lifted pear note. It's fruit-driven but elegant and understated. The finish is both lemon-fresh and smooth.

title: Ancien 2016 Sangiacomo Vineyard Pinot Gris (Carneros)
description: From a vineyard known better for Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, this lovely aromatic white is well crafted and fruity, dry with a creaminess to the texture that's beguiling without becoming too much. Lemon, quince and apricot flavors provide a bright, lingering fleshiness that will work deliciously at the table. It spent six months in neutral French oak.

title: Barale Fratelli 2013 Bussia  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of red woodland berry, rose, culinary spice, new leather and a whiff of camphor lead the way on this fragrant red. Taut and refined, this is a textbook Barolo, offering red cherry, cranberry, white pepper and star anise flavors set against a backbone of tightly wound, fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Give it time to unwind. Drink 2023–2038.

title: Bernhard Ott 2016 Ried Spiegel Grüner Veltliner (Wagram)
description: This wine's fresh, fruity nose is most inviting, recalling freshly cut Conference pear and the lovely tang of miso and yeast. The palate is evenly balanced between yeasty, salty savoriness and the yellow and green pear notes, creating a lively and full-flavored white with a long, dry finish.

title: Birichino 2014 Antle Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chalone)
description: There's a lot of wild thyme, dusty creek bed and rainy cement on the nose of this bottling, with only the slightest hint of cranberry fruit. The palate's tension is tremendous, which is common for the appellation, with crushed sandstone and rugged earthiness cloaking the cran-hibiscus flavors. It's lightly bodied but firm with upright tannins.

title: Alheit 2015 Hemelrand Vine Garden White (Hemel en Aarde)
description: A blend of 48% Roussanne, 27% Chenin Blanc, 22% Chardonnay and 3% Verdelho, herbal aromas of dried fynbos, hay and pressed yellow flowers are partnered with rich notes of yellow apple, citrus oil and beeswax. The medium-weight palate offers great acidity that enlivens the ripe fruit flavors, while a saline impression provides further lift and lingers long on the close. Drink now–2021.

title: Domaine Guenaël Jambon 2016 Côte du Py Réserve  (Morgon)
description: Big and bold, this is a rich wine, packed with both fruit and a dense mineral texture. The wine is ripe, full of blackberry flavors and good acidity that will allow it to develop. This has structure, tannins and will age well. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine Lathuilière Gravallon 2016 Corcelette  (Morgon)
description: Rich and structured, this wine offers tense tannins balanced by an underlay of ripe black fruits and acidity, although these will take time to come through. Full of ripe tannins, it needs time. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine les Evigneaux 2015 Red (Rasteau)
description: Layers of vanilla, spice and anise are prominent from nose to finish, but this lavish red also offers deep reserves of succulent black fruit, bramble and earth. It's a bold, rather opulent wine framed by ripe, densely structured tannins and fresh acidity. It should continue to improve through 2025.

title: Eder 2016 Federspiel Riesling (Wachau)
description: A hint of quince and apple peel clings to this wine's lemony aromas. The palate centers on lithe, high-toned lemon freshness. It's slender and bright, brimming with lemon zest and flesh in equal measure. The clean finish also leaves a lasting lemon note.

title: Eder 2016 Ried Süssenberg Federspiel Grüner Veltliner (Wachau)
description: Fragrant, ripe apricot scents hover above pear and herb base notes on the nose of this wine. On the concentrated palate, they add smooth fluidity to the yeasty, salty, herb-tinged texture. Pure lemon freshness adds incisive, welcome and beautiful brightness, making this both slender and utterly delicious.

title: Fattoria di Lamole 2013 Vigna Grospoli Antico Lamole Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Made entirely with organically farmed Sangiovese, this offers aromas of violet, red-skinned berry and underbrush. The vibrant, elegant palate delivers succulent red cherry, licorice, clove and aromatic herb alongside polished, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2018–2027.
designation: Vigna Grospoli Antico Lamole Gran Selezione

title: Foley 2015 T Anchor Ranch Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Sagebrush, French toast and raspberry-syrup aromas make for a dynamic and delicious nose on this bottling. Then chaparral spice meets with salt, pepper, bay leaf and juniper on the palate, spicing up the ripe dark-red fruits.

title: Gunter Triebaumer 2016 Ried Geyerumriss Chardonnay (Burgenland)
description: A floral note of white blossom hovers above this wine's lemon and hazelnut notes. The creamy palate provides a lemon flavor that is both bright and rich at the same time. A lovely wine that will improve with time. Drink 2019–2026.

title: Hertelendy 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This blends in 11% Petit Verdot, 7% Merlot, 5% Malbec and 1% Cabernet Franc, the whole aged nearly two years in 90% new French oak. Brawny in leather saddle, clove, dark chocolate and a substantial backbone of dense tannin, it's also rounded and fleshy in black cherry and cassis, with fresh, focused acidity.

title: Hirsch 2016 Ried Gaisberg Riesling (Kamptal)
description: A flinty touch of reduction plays among the zesty, aromatic orange notes on the nose. The palate is fluid and light, with an earthy background but ultimately lemon flavors set the tone on the slight, light body. The finish is dry and full of citrus notes.

title: Hirsch 2016 Ried Renner Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: This leads with an impression of yeasty, funky richness. That lovely funkiness then turns to great concentration on the palate as leesy, salty savory notes combine with celery, sage and fern flavors. A pure lemon note is a lovely and fresh accent on the long, salty finish.

title: Jessie's Grove 2013 Royal Tee Ancient Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This is a big flavor-packed wine made from some of Lodi's oldest vines. It's quite deep in color, very fruity in aroma, full in body and with nice depth to the ripe blackberry and boysenberry flavors. Accents of black pepper and clove emerge with each sip, while the wine has enough tannin and more than enough body to give a good sense of heft.

title: La Pitchoune 2014 VDK Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)
description: A brightness of cherry and cranberry shines in this medium-bodied well-integrated wine, that has a complexity of texture that offers a slight grittiness. Cardamom, clove and white pepper successfully season the fruit.

title: Lang & Reed 2014 Two-Fourteen Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: A 100% varietal wine from the Entav clone, intended to showcase a Loire Valley-style, this does indeed possess grace and charm, with a well-developed sense of dried herb and violet. Soft and expansive in texture, it features integrated tannins within a strong sense of French oak, allowing plenty of room for expansive raspberry flavors to burst throughout.

title: Leth 2016 Ried Scheiben Roter Veltliner (Wagram)
description: The scent of ripe, tangy red apple peel sets the appetizing tone for this wine made from an indigenous grape. The palate has a slender but textured, pithy feel, made lively by lemony freshness. An incredibly gastronomic white for those wanting something unusual. The finish is wonderfully dry and tangy with citrus notes.

title: Loimer 2016 Ried Loiserberg Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: Freshly cut yellow pear peel aromas hover above a rich yeasty note on the nose of this wine. The palate counters this with an almost fizzy note of lemon freshness that accentuates both its core of pear fruit and the celery and sage notes of the salty yeast. Very refreshing and moreish.

title: Mullineux 2015 Granite Syrah (Swartland)
description: Attractive scents of brambly berry and red plum set the stage on the nose of this bright, spicy wine. A pleasant herbaceous, stalky note coupled with a peppery lift lend depth and complexity, while final flavors of church incense, cola spice and tilled soil unfold on the finish. The satiny mouthfeel offers plush tannins and an earthy, mineral texture that provides good grip to the close. Drink now–2026.

title: Nigl 2016 Alte Reben Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: This wine's fresh, green Conference pear notes immediately hit the nose. The slender, dry, streamlined palate adds a streak of fresh, bright lemon. Spicy yeast, celery salt and miso notes appear on the taut, refreshing finish. Lovely.

title: Paul Dolan 2015 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: This wine was aged longer than most in oak barrels, and has wonderful subtleties that make it compelling to sip, savor and sip again. It starts with a light-gold color, then offers tangy citrus aromas that are lighter and leaner than the flavors to follow, which bring ripe pear and subtle baking spices. The body is full and the texture feels smooth, but with a good touch of crisp acidity.

title: Phillips Hill 2015 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Great structure and a brilliant sense of restraint make this vividly flavored and medium-bodied wine a keeper—and nearly as good as the winery's vineyard designates. A couple of years in a cellar or cool closet will enhance its red cherry, tea leaf and rhubarb flavors while softening the rather lean texture just a bit. The wine is elegant, appetizing and will be best after 2020.

title: Portalupi 2015 Shake Ridge Ranch Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This is a standout wine that tastes ripe and full, but also has good balance, a polished texture and a wonderful sense of layering and finesse. Blueberry, blackberry and dark chocolate waft from the glass and equally generous flavors coat the palate, propelled by a velvety layer of fine-grained tannins and full body.

title: Rémi Niero 2013 Eminence  (Côte Rôtie)
description: Vivacious and peppery, this delicately framed Côte-Rôtie offers crisp black-cherry and berry flavors accented by savory truffle, leather and spice. Fine, rigid tannins and penetrating black-fruit flavors still need time to integrate. Hold till 2020.
